oai_dc:dc.dc:title: NORMAL-STATE DC ELECTRICAL-RESISTIVITY IN RE-123 SUPERCONDUCTORS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DATTA, A
SRIVASTAVA, CM
VENKATARAMANI, N
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electronic-structure
high-temperature
tc
yba2cu3o7-delta
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have examined the DC electrical resistivity of RE-123 superconductors (where RE is a rare earth element) on the basis of a model of correlated electron transfer arising from the electron-phonon interaction. The small polaron stabilization energy (epsilon(p)) has been obtained from the fitting of the normal state resistivity data. A correlation between the lattice parameters of the unit cell and epsilon(p) has been observed which is explained on the basis of fermiology.
